page.title: 12FARMING - DEER
page.content: A years' work of the head gamekeeper on the Ben Alder Estate. Ben Alder is 25,000acres. It is financed from business in London and belongs to Mr. Byam-Cooke. The estate has 1,000 hinds and 400 stage at the 1985 deer count. Jan/Feb. The deer are fed on cattle cake and hay at a cost of Â£5,000 a year. Both male and females mix together for the feeding in winter time but this is abnormal behaviour. They usually only meet at mating time and stray on different parts of the hills. A long trail of food is left to feed all ages of deer for 1-2 miles long each day. The Royal stags with 12 points on their antlers are given whisky as extra food. The weather changes quickly to arctic conditions and Mr. Oswald keeps alert for hikers in distress.
